alert.note: Alert for Northampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 1:55PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Northampton County through 245 PM EDT... At 153 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles south of Cape Charles, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cape Charles, Cheriton and Bay View around 220 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Simpkins, Capeville, Townsend, Kiptopeke State Park, Oyster, Eastville, Cheapside, Kiptopeke, Plantation and Dalbys. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
